content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Electricity Generator at Position (x=19.5, y=-1.5)
Consists of:
- Offshore Pump at Position (x=19.5, y=-1.5)
- Boiler at Position (x=20.5, y=-4.0)
- Steam Engine at Position (x=27.5, y=-7.5)
- Pipe Network connecting the above components

### Iron Plate Production Facility
Consists of:
- Burner Mining Drill at Position (x=-11.0, y=20.0) connected to a Wooden Chest at Position (x=-11.5, y=18.5) for iron ore collection
- Stone Furnace at Position (x=0.0, y=0.0) for smelting iron ore into iron plates

### Copper Plate Production Facility
Consists of:
- Burner Mining Drill at Position (x=20.0, y=20.0) connected to a Wooden Chest at Position (x=19.5, y=18.5) for copper ore collection
- Stone Furnace at Position (x=2.0, y=0.0) for smelting copper ore into copper plates

### Copper Cable Factory
Consists of:
- Assembling Machine at Position (x=10.5, y=0.5) for producing copper cables
- Inserter at Position (x=13.5, y=0.5) feeding the assembling machine
- Belt Group connecting the furnace to the assembling machine

### Storage and Transport System
- Multiple Wooden Chests at various positions for storing resources
- Belt Group for transporting items between structures

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors in Connecting Pipes
- Ensure that the pipe network is continuous and properly aligned to connect the offshore pump to the steam engine. Verify that all connection points are correctly positioned.

### Errors in Fuel Management
- Maintain sufficient coal in your inventory to fuel boilers and furnaces. Regularly check and replenish coal supplies to avoid production halts.

### Errors in Resource Availability
- Ensure that all required resources are available for the assembling machine to produce items. Check the inventory and supply lines to prevent missing ingredients.

### Errors in Electrical Connections
- Verify that all electrical components are properly connected to the power grid. Ensure that poles and wires are correctly placed to provide power to all machines and inserters.

### Inserter Placement and Power Issues
- Position inserters correctly to ensure they can pick up and drop items as intended. Make sure they are connected to a power source to avoid operational interruptions.
